title: BBC Local Live: Northamptonshire for Wednesday, 6 January 2016 - BBC News
summary: a man from raunds has been arrested in a dawn raid linked to a cold case murder .
saints back coach alex king says he had no intention of leaving the club despite england speculation .
some gp surgeries in northamptonshire say patient safety is being `` put at risk '' due to increasing demand .
more news , sport , weather and travel from 08:00 on thursday .

documents.title: our live coverage throughout the day
text: that 's it for today folks - we 've had gp practices under pressure , ghostly apparitions in weedon , and saints ' alex king dismissing the speculation around a possible move to the england set up .
we 'll be back at 08:00 tomorrow with more news , weather , travel and updates for northamptonshire .
in the meantime , if you want to get in touch , please email , tweet us or head to facebook .

documents.title: christmas drink drive arrests up slightly
text: the number of people arrested for drink-driving in northamptonshire over christmas and the new year is up on the previous year .
a total of 78 people were arrested for driving over the limit during northamptonshire police 's drink-drive campaign in december 2015 - two more arrests than the same period in 2014 .
a further 10 people were arrested for drug driving .
author: Sarah Foster
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: a508 congestion : council 'regrets ' delays for motorists
text: northamptonshire county council says it `` regrets '' the long delays motorists have been experiencing on the a508 while roadworks have been in place .
the works at the boughton roundabout are in place to allow infrastructure for the new buckton fields housing development to be installed .
a council spokesman said : `` if road users are able to stagger their journeys , or have an alternative route , we would advise them to do so until the work is completed at the end of this week . ''
author: Anna Bartlett
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: a wholesale power grab : how the uk government is handing housing over to private developers
text: dr bob colenutt from the university of northampton gives his view on private housing developers :
in any sane universe , something called the housing and planning bill might safely be assumed to stimulate house building and improve planning .
but the bill , which receives its third and final reading in the house of commons today , does exactly the opposite of what it says on the tin .
author: The Guardian

documents.title: motorists warned of severe congestion on a508 at boughton
text: temporary traffic lights and roadworks on the a508 north of northampton - which have caused long delays for motorists this week - will continue until saturday .
the works , taking place near the boughton roundabout , are in place to allow a utility company to install infrastructure for the new buckton fields development .
the four way traffic lights will now be manually operated to allow for changes in traffic flow .
author: Anna Bartlett
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: christmas pudding bush in gretton reunited with owner
text: as festive traditions go , one in the village of gretton near corby is quite unique - each year , two very old , round box trees are decorated to resemble christmas puddings .
but just before christmas one of the one hundred-year-old bushes was stolen ; ripped out of the ground with some force .
today residents are celebrating as the 'pudding bush ' has been recovered and replanted .
author: Carroll Weston
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: mp backs man 's fight for justice after death of his son in northampton care home
text: an mp has taken up a father 's fight for justice following the death of his son in care .
author: Northampton Chronicle & Echo

documents.title: saga of the lost pudding in gretton comes to an end
text: a 100-year old box tree - which was stolen from outside a house in gretton - has been reunited with its owners .
the tree is one of two which had been decorated to look like christmas puddings .
one of the pair went missing before christmas , but following a facebook appeal has been recovered after being found dumped behind a hedge in a nearby layby .
residents helped to retrieve it and it 's now been replanted in its original spot .
author: Carroll Weston
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: norovirus : the signs and symptoms
text: with health bosses in northamptonshire urging people to help prevent the spread of norovirus , just what is the bug and how can you spot the signs ?
for most people it is no worse than a short bout of diarrhoea and vomiting that should clear up within 24-72 hours .
however , for the more vulnerable , it can have a more significant effect .
nene ccg - which delivers healthcare across northamptonshire - has issued the following advice :
author: Anna Bartlett
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: ghost on horseback - can you see it ?
text: a photo taken by a northampton man is all over the tabloid newspapers today - as it apparently captures a ghost on horseback in a graveyard .
the graveyard is in weedon - and the man who took the richard durham .
he told me earlier : `` some people think i 've had one too many sherbets , but i can see it and so can other people - and whether people can believe in ghosts or not , it 's there . ''
the is on our facebook page , where you can also leave your comments .
author: Annabel Amos
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: nhs bosses urge people to help prevent the spread of norovirus
text: health bosses in the county are urging the public to help prevent the spread of the highly contagious winter sickness bug , norovirus .
the bug is very common at this time of year and outbreaks are being reported around northamptonshire
the nhs says it can be very dangerous to the elderly and sick - and is asking people who have experienced diarrhoea and vomiting to stay away from hospitals if at all possible .
author: Anna Bartlett
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: indecent exposure in northampton 's grosvenor centre
text: police are searching for a man who indecently exposed himself to another man in the grosvenor centre public toilet at 17:10 on wednesday , 30 december .
officers say the offender , described as white , in his early 20s , around 5ft 8ins tall , with a tall , slim or scrawny build with blonde-like hair and .
a hearing aid , exposed himself to the victim before `` carrying out a lewd act '' .

documents.title: northampton firm fined after worker struck by bus
text: a northampton company contracted to lay a pipe across station road in long buckby in 2014 has been fined £ 12,000 following a serious injury to a worker .
during the roadworks , a worker was struck by a bus and suffered injuries , including a dislocated knee and severe ligament and muscle damage .

rebeck communications limited , of billing road , northampton , pleaded guilty to breaching construction regulations at northampton magistrates ' court after the health and safety executive said a safety zone had not been maintained .
author: Anna Bartlett
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: council closes 'filthy ' food business in wellingborough
text: emergency hygiene powers were used by environmental health officers in wellingborough to close a newly opened food business .

sklep miesny u jasia , based on midland road , had no hot water supply , no hand washing facilities where raw meat and ready to eat foods were being handled , and dirty water and waste on the floor in the rear food preparation and storage areas .

officers decided there was an imminent health risk and served a hygiene emergency prohibition notice upon jadlo spod strzechy limited to close it until the health risk had been removed - which was confirmed by northampton magistrates ' court on tuesday , 22 december .
author: Anna Bartlett
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: family-run northampton music shop down but not out as it downsizes in battle with online shopping
text: an independent family-run music store in northampton has relocated next door to a smaller premises - as it battles to cope with the boom of online shopping .
author: Northants Herald & Post

documents.title: northamptonshire surgeries 'may have to close '
text: some gp practices in northampton have got so few gps they may actually have to close .
that is the view of dr jamie green , from delapre medical centre , who was speaking after the bbc revealed at least 100 surgeries nationally applied to stop taking on new patients in 2014/15 ,

dr green said : `` we 're also seeing that some practices have got so few gps that actually nobody wants to go and work there ; and what that might mean is that rather than just closing lists you might actually see surgeries closing . ''
author: Elinor Cross
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: saints alex king says media speculation was 'frustrating '
text: saints back coach alex king says he 's been frustrated by media speculation linking him to the england set-up .
speaking to me earlier , he confirmed his future is with northampton saints :
`` i think eddie has met most of the coaches and directors of rugby in england now , to get as much information as he can about his squad , moving into the six nations , '' he said .
`` just because you have a conversation with eddie jones , does n't mean there 's any more to it . ''
author: Graham McKechnie
BBC Radio Northampton sport

documents.title: saints alex king : `` i 'm staying ''
text: northampton saints back coach alex king says he was never going to be leaving the club - despite speculation linking him with england .

he was very clear about his future when i spoke to him earlier , saying : `` there 's been a lot of unfounded speculation and i 'm just glad that now i can move on and concentrate on the game ( against leicester ) on saturday . ''
author: Graham McKechnie
BBC Radio Northampton sport

documents.title: cold case murder detectives arrest man from raunds area
text: police in cambridgeshire say dawn raids by officers investigating an unsolved murder , have resulted in the arrests of eight people this morning - including one from northamptonshire .
andrew bedford - who was 27 and from huntingdon - was last seen in september 1990 .
cold case detectives think he was killed with a shotgun sometime during the evening of 28 september at a garage in ramsey .
a 52-year-old man from the raunds area was arrested this morning on sus of assisting an offender and conspiracy to prevent lawful burial .
he has been taken to march police station in cambridgshire for questioning .
author: David Keller
BBC News

documents.title: kettering cafe run by johnny 's happy place to extend opening times
text: a cafe run by the family and friends of a man who took his own life is to extend its opening hours due to its popularity .
author: Northamptonshire Telegraph

documents.title: northants 'logistics hub ' perfect for rail central , says developer
text: freight interchanges like the proposed rail central development between blisworth and milton malsor are `` supported by the government as a whole , '' the developers have said .

planning director for rail central , claire cope , said the 8m sq ft ( 743,200 sq metre ) facility , which would include warehouses and a lorry park , was a `` prime location '' with great connectivity .
she said government policy encourages freight distribution and that northamptonshire `` is recognised as a logistics hub ' .
author: Craig Lewis
BBC News

documents.title: bmw confirms plan to expand its northampton warehouse and create 70 new jobs
text: car maker bmw has applied to expand its part distribution factory in northampton by 150,000 sq ft in a move it says would create 70 new jobs .
author: Northampton Chronicle & Echo

documents.title: lamborghini careers off a45 near higham ferrers and ends up in lake
text: two people managed to swim to safety after the lamborghini they were travelling in hit the central reservation and collided with another barrier before ending up in a fishing lake .
author: Northamptonshire Telegraph

documents.title: latest headlines : raunds man arrested in cold case murder investigation gp surgeries call for more support from the government
text: the top stories in northamptonshire this lunchtime :
author: Sarah Foster
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: man from raunds arrested in connection with murder 25 years ago
text: a man from the raunds area has been arrested in connection with the murder of a man in cambridgeshire 25 years ago .
andrew bedford - who was 27 and from huntingdon - was last seen in september 1990 .
the 52-year-old , from the raunds area , is one of eight people arrested in dawn raids this morning - on sus of assisting an offender and conspiracy to prevent lawful burial .
author: David Keller
BBC News

documents.title: 'crocoholic ' collector 's first buy 'looked pretty cool '
text: a self-proclaimed 'crocoholic ' who has more than 6,000 novelty crocodiles says he bought his first crocodile after his partner at the time sent him out to buy furniture .
andrew grey said he `` thought it looked pretty cool '' .
author: Tom Percival
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: northampton standpipe running since june 'will be turned off soon '
text: anglian water has pledged to find an alternative solution after unsuccessfully trying to flush a northampton water main since june .
author: Northampton Chronicle & Echo

documents.title: six people injured in serious accident near stoke albany
text: six people were injured following a four vehicle collision on the a427 near stoke albany last night - three of them seriously .
a red vw bora , driven by a 26-year-old man , and a white mercedes axor lorry , driven by a 54-year-old man , were both travelling towards market harborough when the collision took place .
a blue seat leon , driven by a 64-year-old man , and a grey vw fox , driven by a 27-year-old woman , were travelling in the opposite direction .
the injured people were taken to kettering hospital , queens medical centre in nottingham and university hospital coventry .
author: Anna Bartlett
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: 'political pressure ' is dampening down gp concerns , bma claim
text: richard vautrey , from the british medical association ( bma ) , says the government and nhs bosses need to be more honest about the serious pressures on gp surgeries .

`` one of the issues they have is the political pressure from above to try and dampen down any concerns that gps are raising , but we ca n't hide from the problem that practices are raising right around the country , '' he said .
`` we simply do n't have enough gp 's to deal with the rising workload pressures that practices are under . ''
author: Elinor Cross
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: witnesses of serious stoke albany accident urged to come forward
text: police are appealing for people who witnessed a serious four vehicle collision near stoke albany last night to contact them .
the collision took place on the a427 near the stoke hill turning at 18:20 and involved a red vw bora , blue seat leon , grey vw fox and a white mercedes axor lorry .
it 's believed the bora was overtaking the lorry when it had a minor collision with the leon , before colliding with the vw fox and the lorry .
author: Anna Bartlett
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: campaigners ask if new rail interchange is needed when dirft is n't at capacity ?
text: campaigners against a planned rail interchange in south northamptonshire say the facility is n't necessary because the daventry international rail freight terminal ( dirft ) is n't yet at capacity .
developer ashfield land is talking to residents ahead of a full consultation on the plans , which would include warehouses , a lorry park , a service depot , and a hotel and pub .
milton malsor parish councillor shaun hope said : `` dirft has still got another 17 years before it is at capacity so we are not sure why this is being considered at milton malsor and blisworth . ''
author: Craig Lewis
BBC News

documents.title: northamptonshire gps say increased demand is 'putting patient safety at risk '
text: several family doctors and practice managers in northamptonshire say patients ' safety is being `` put at risk '' because gp surgeries are struggling to cope with demand .
it comes as a bbc investigation reveals at least 100 surgeries nationally applied to stop taking on new patients in 2014/15 .
half of them were ordered to stay open by the nhs , meaning surgeries already under pressure are being forced to take on new patients or face sanctions .

despite this evidence , trish thompson from nhs england maintains there is no problem with list closures in northamptonshire , but doctors in the county have told bbc radio northampton that if they 're forced to keep lists open patient safety could be put at risk .
author: Elinor Cross
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: northampton town : new striker admits it was tough to leave shrewsbury
text: northampton town 's new striker james collins has admitted it was tough to leave his former club .
the 25-year-old arrived at sixfields on loan until the end of the season yesterday , just 72 hours after captaining shrewsbury in what was his 154th game for them .

he said : `` there 's some budget issues at shrewsbury and it 's not been going the way we wanted i spoke to the gaffer and we thought it would be best on all parties to make way and free up some money . ''
author: Graham McKechnie
BBC Radio Northampton sport

documents.title: rail central plans would 'blight ' blisworth and milton malsor
text: a new strategic rail interchange earmarked for land between blisworth and milton malsor will `` blight '' the two villages .
that 's the view of blisworth resident , mark redding , who said the `` immense project '' would ruin 250 hectares of farmland and cause 24/7 noise and light pollution .
the 8m sq ft ( 743,200 sq metre ) rail central development is planned for land at arm farm in milton malsor .
author: Craig Lewis
BBC News

documents.title: county 's pcc launches new community award
text: northamptonshire 's police and crime commissioner , adam simmonds , has launched a new award for people who make a difference in their community .
the winner of the first commissioner 's award for outstanding contribution to northamptonshire will be announced in march with nominations open until the end of the month .
leanne buckingham , from the commissioner 's office , said : `` for the commissioner it 's absolutely imperative we give back something when somebody gives it to us . ''
author: Andrew Radd
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: english gp surgeries reach new patient 'breaking point '
text: large numbers of gp surgeries across the country have stopped taking on new patients , with at least 100 having applied to nhs england to stop accepting new patients in 2014/15 .

it is a story bbc northampton 's elinor cross has been following in the county for some time , highlighted by the decision of kettering gp , dr hadrian moss , to close his list to new patients despite not having permission for nhs england to do so .
author: Craig Lewis
BBC News

documents.title: school place deadline looms
text: parents across the county are being reminded that the deadline for applying for a school place for their child is just over a week away .
families wanting to send a child to an infant or junior school in september have to get the forms filled in by 15 january .
author: Andrew Radd
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: crocodile collector from northampton claims world record
text: a man who has collected more than 6,000 novelty crocodiles is claiming a new world record .
andrew gray , who calls himself a 'crocoholic ' , keeps 6,739 crocodile related items at his home in burton latimer , northamptonshire .
he is using the collection to raise money for two hos
he said he became the official 'biggest collector of crocodiles in the world ' after breaking an existing record of 1,000 items .
guinness world records could not be contacted for comment .
author: Tom Percival
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: latest headlines : gp surgeries 'struggling to cope ' pcc launches new award
text: here are the top stories we 're looking at this morning :
author: Andrew Radd
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: today 's weather : fog and scattered showers
text: any early mist or fog will clear to leave some bright spells across the county with the chance of a shower in some places .
maximum temperature : 7c ( 45f ) .
author: Kate Kinsella
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: travel : queuing traffic on a508
text: there is queuing traffic in the roadworks on the a508 in boughton at the brampton lane junction .
get the latest updates from bbc travel .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: welcome to local live for northamptonshire
text: good morning and welcome to today 's live page where we 'll be bringing you the latest news , weather , sport and travel for the county between now and 18:00 .
if you want to get in touch then please email me , tweet us or head to facebook .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live
